main event: A civilian in Phoenix, Arizona reported sighting an unidentified flying object on 2nd July 1952, described as a 'ball of fire' with a flame trail, flying in a shallow arc and disappearing behind a house.
interesting points: The observed object was described as a 'ball of fire' with a platinum cutting across its diameter, approximately 7 to 8 inches in diameter, and emitting a yellow flame similar to that of a candle.
The object left a trail of flame that extended six to eight feet behind it, with the speed being faster than searchlights reflected on clouds.
The observation lasted around 3 to 4 minutes, and the object was seen flying in a shallow arc before disappearing behind a house.
The witness mentioned being far-sighted, having lived near many air bases, and frequently scanning the sky to identify passing objects.
Weather conditions at the time of sighting were clear with good visibility and no meteorological phenomena reported.
sighted object: ball of fire with a flame trail
